allSaves.value: +1 status on all saves vs. magic

details.recallKnowledgeText:
Recall Knowledge - Fiend : DC 24

Recall Knowledge - Humanoid : DC 24
details.flavorText: Onidoshi, or ogre mages, are oni with the material form of an ogre. Onidoshi's supernatural prowess and overwhelming intellect are enough to awe and cow entire families of rank-and-file ogres. Because of this, onidoshi are often found at the head of ogre war parties or orchestrating these violent campaigns from behind the scenes. It's rare for onidoshi to lead solitary existences, but those who do prefer to maraud the countryside or exploit villages and hoard the spoils for themselves.

description.value:
Icy cold rushes forth from your hands. You deal 12d6 cold damage to creatures in the area.

Heightened The damage increases by 2d6.
description.label: Description

description.value:
To the target, your words are honey and your visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if you or your allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it.

You can Dismiss the spell. If you use hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with you or the actions you convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning you could potentially convince the target to continue being your friend via mundane means.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and aware you tried to charm it.

Success The target is unaffected but thinks your spell was something harmless instead of charm, unless it identifies the spell (Identifying Spells section on page 305).

Failure The target's attitude becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.v66R7FdOf11l94im]{Friendly} toward you. If it was @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.v66R7FdOf11l94im]{Friendly}, it becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.v44P3WUcU1j0115l]{Helpful}. It can't use hostile actions against you.

Critical Failure The target's attitude becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.v44P3WUcU1j0115l]{Helpful} toward you, and it can't use hostile actions against you.

Heightened The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations.

Heightened The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations, and you can target up to 10 creatures.
description.label: Description

description.value: The target transforms into a vaporous state. In this state, the target is amorphous and loses any item bonus to AC. It gains resistance 8 to physical damage and is immune to precision damage. It can't cast spells, activate items, or use actions that have the attack or manipulate trait. It gains a fly Speed of 10 feet and can slip through tiny cracks. The target can Dismiss the spell.
description.label: Description

description.value:
Each creature in the area becomes drowsy and might fall asleep. A creature that falls @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} from this spell doesn't fall @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} or release what it's holding. This spell doesn't prevent creatures from waking up due to a successful Perception check, limiting its utility in combat.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes a â€“1 status penalty to Perception checks for 1 round.

Failure The creature falls @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If it's still @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} after 1 minute, it wakes up automatically.

Critical Failure The creature falls @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If it's still @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} after 1 hour, it wakes up automatically.

Heightened The creatures fall @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} for 1 round on a failure or 1 minute on a critical failure. They fall @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and release what they're holding, and they can't attempt Perception checks to wake up. When the duration ends, the creature is sleeping normally instead of automatically waking up.
description.label: Description

description.value:
You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} 1.

Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} 2.

Critical Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} 3 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Heightened You can target up to five creatures.
description.label: Description

description.value:
You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical light of your darkness spell's level or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness.

Heightened Even creatures with darkvision (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}.
description.label: Description

description.value:
Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. This makes it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.
description.label: Description

description.value: Trigger A creature within the monsterâ€™s reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action itâ€™s using. Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesnâ€™t count toward the monsterâ€™s multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesnâ€™t apply to this Strike.

This monster regains the listed number of Hit Points each round at the beginning of its turn. Its @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Dying] condition never increases beyond @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Dying] 3 as long as its regeneration is active. However, if it takes damage of a type listed in the regeneration entry, its regeneration deactivates until the end of its next turn. Deactivate the regeneration before applying any damage of a listed type, since that damage might kill the monster by bringing it to @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Dying] 4.

The onidoshi takes on the appearance of an ogre. This doesn't change their Speed or Strike attack and damage.
The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monsterâ€™s transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesnâ€™t gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.
